name: Hotel Design de la Sorbonne

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved this hotel. It was in a great location. The room was small but most rooms in Paris are. The lift is unbelievably small but handy for taking luggage. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel as there are loads of good value cafes in the area.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights at the beginning of January. We stayed in a twin room (the beds were pushed together and made up as the 1 bed) on the 5th floor.
reviews.title: Fabulous location, clean & quiet.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is whisper quiet. The heating is very very efficient - so much so that we slept with the window open and curtains shut and were still toasty warm (with the heater on its lowest setting). It is walking distance from almost everything (my husband and I love to walk). We even walked to the Eiffel tower, but took the train back.
reviews.title: Boutique hotel for iMac lovers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As other reviews have mentioned the bathroon is microscopic. My husband and I are both very tall but knew about the bathroom after reading the reviews. It is fine and we managed for our stay.
reviews.title: Great room, great view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The computer software needs upgrading for you to be able to use the full use of the free internet. Was not a major issue for us.
reviews.title: Sweet hotel in the Latin Quarter

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was perfect for a recent trip to Central Paris. What stood out to us was the way the staff were so friendly and helpful - they couldn't have done more if they tried. We don't speak very good French but they were happy to speak to us in English and as soon as we'd ask for directions somewhere, they took out a map and marked where we were in comparison to our destination and told us the best route. We also forgot to take a travel adapter but the hotel had one and lent it to us for our whole stay! There are also umbrellas to borrow free of charge - these came in very handy as it poured down when we were there. This hotel is in walking distance to Notre Dame Cathedral and we also managed to walk from the hotel to the Louvre Museum, Champs-Elysee and Eiffel Tower! Public transport wasn't really needed in our case so this hotel was perfectly located. If you're travelling from Orly Airport, catch the Orlyval (signposted Airport Shuttle at the airport!) to Antony Station. Then catch RER B to Luxembourg Station. From there it's just a 5-min walk to the hotel. It's 10.50 euros per adult one way. Would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Paris and would def stay there again!
reviews.title: Amazing customer service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was perfect for our visit in Paris. The room was quite small, however, the location was great. It is near the direct train line to the airport and walking distance to most attractions or at least a transportation option. The Sorbonne area is quiet and peaceful for being right in the city. The breakfast was good along with great service. We enjoyed the wi-fi and apple TV.
reviews.title: Great, enjoyed the hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights Fri-Mon with my partner. The hotel is a lovely boutique style hotel check in staff was quick and straightforward and the staff were pleasant, our room was located on the ground floor onto the courtyard, room although small we were more than happy with the layout, bathroom is functional was a fantastic shower. The free use of apple computer in our room was a great addition to our stay and allowed us to do some research in the area for dinner/sightseeing etc. Only negative I had on the room was the temperature we were there in December and the room was extremely warm with the air con not available during winter months. We didn't eat at the hotel. The hotel is located a short walk from the Patheon and about a 10min walk from Notre Dame.
reviews.title: Weekend Break in Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Overall i would recommend this hotel to any couples visiting Paris.
reviews.title: Great people at the reception, very good position

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have been there for the 2nd time. Few Hotel owners understand how much is important to have professional and motivated people at the reception. I guess the Hotel Manager of HDLS worked on that because the reception service is excellent. Fluent in several languages, kind and smiling but withouth exceeding...
reviews.title: Chic Parisian bolt hole

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Hotel Design Sorbonne for 3 nights just after Christmas. It's in a great location just a few minutes from the Luxembourg metro station on a direct line from CDG airport. It's about 10 mins walk from Notre Dam with the bustling Blvd Saint-German full of restaurants and cafes on the way.
reviews.title: Lovely little boutique hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Our room was small, as you'd expect. The bedroom area was perfectly fine with a nice view from the 5th floor over the Sorbonne university plus aircon and a TV/Apple PC to play with. The bathroom, though, was just a little too small for comfort - you had to perform a twist to sit on the toilet and the shower cubicle was so narrow I really struggled to wash properly.
reviews.title: Nice Stay - Another Hotel in the Hotels Paris Rive Gauche Group

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: As mentioned there was a PC in the room to freely surf the net and do a bit of research on before venturing out. This was really handy. The hotel also provided free WiFi but I struggled to get connected to this using either my iPhone or iPad so had to rely on the PC in the room.
reviews.title: A gem in the Latin Quarter

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The staff were all very friendly and helpful and spoke excellent English. The hotel was beautifully decorated inside and seemed well maintained.
reviews.title: Good stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had breakfast included, this was taken in a tiny room with barely enough space to swing a cat. The breakfast itself was continental and perfectly adequate but I would say not worth paying extra for if your price doesn't already include it.
reviews.title: Pretty good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011
reviews.text: Great hotel, lovely service from all staff. Rooms are an average size for Paris. Fab location. Liking the apple mac's in the rooms- wish all hotels had this!
reviews.title: Excellent stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Really loved our stay here. Great location, wonderful quirkily decorated rooms and lovely staff who were very helpful. Love the little touches like having umbrellas for guests in reception. The rooms are small but what they've done with the space is wonderful.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have two tips - first, the hotel website recommends you get the RER B train from the airport to Luxembourg station. In fact getting the RER B direct from CDG to Cluny Sorbonne leaves you about 5minutes walk from the hotel and is closer.
reviews.title: Quirky French treat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Second, become a fan on Facebook as you get preferential rates - lower even than on their website!
reviews.title: "Wow" when entered in room, better than expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just arrived home after enjoying a short stay here. The rooms were small but perfectly formed, quirky decorated with everything you might need. We were on the 5th floor which was a bit of a hike (although there was the smallest lift ever) but worth it as we had a fab view over towards the Pantheon and all down the street. I would recommend a fab chocolate/ Icecream place called Amorino which we had the best hot chocolate EVER which was on rue soufflet just around the corner from the hotel. I would definitely recommend visiting the Pantheon as it was such a beautiful old building I loved more than the Notre Dame yet wasn't even on our map as a place to visit. We ate at the Au Bougnat restaurant on rue Chanoinesse near the Notre Dame as strongly recommended on trip advisor but we thought it was below average for the money we paid which was around €90 for 2 people having 2 courses and 2 half bottles of wine. I used to work in a Michelin starred restaurant in England and we could have eaten three courses and the same amount of wine for cheaper and it would have been a million times better.... i'd say well over priced for what it is, and it didn't really taste like french cuisine to me. We ate lunch in a cafe the next day and it was much more enjoyable for a much much much lower cost. on our walk back to the hotel after dinner we stopped off at a cocktail bar called Curio Parlor on the rue des Bernardins which was very quirky and was a sneaky little find hidden from everywhere. the cocktails weren't cheap and extremely strong but fab especially when we asked for something not on the menu they were happy to cater to us, helpful staff and a great atmosphere.
reviews.title: Good but could be better...

description: A bigger brighter lobby, all-new designer rooms, new sound system, new breakfast area, new photo exhibition on every floor, unlimited free internet access, a freshly-cleaned fa??ade... you'll be amazed and delighted by the new Hotel Sorbonne! Total comfort, refreshing style and attention to detail; all our rooms have been fully renovated with daring designer fabrics, sumptuous wallpaper, completely new bathrooms and your own iMac for surfing the web, watching a DVD or checking your e-mail.
